thread.title: Kerala violence: After deed is done, RSS has habit of distancing itself; it disowned Nathuram Godse too, says Sitaram Yechuri
thread.title_full: Kerala violence: After deed is done, RSS has habit of distancing itself; it disowned Nathuram Godse too, says Sitaram Yechuri

author: FE Online
title: Kerala violence: After deed is done, RSS has habit of distancing itself; it disowned Nathuram Godse too, says Sitaram Yechuri

organizations.name: sitaram yechuri senior communist party of india

text:
India news Kerala violence: After deed is done, RSS has habit of distancing itself; it disowned Nathuram Godse too, says Sitaram Yechuri Kerala violence: After deed is done, RSS has habit of distancing itself; it disowned Nathuram Godse too, says Sitaram Yechuri Senior Communist Party of India (Marxist) leader Sitaram Yechury on Friday attacked RSS while talking about the violence that is taking place in the state of Kerala. By: FE Online | New Delhi | Updated: March 3, 2017 4:28 PM Senior CPI (M) leader Sitaram Yechury. (ANI) 
Senior Communist Party of India (Marxist) leader Sitaram Yechury on Friday attacked the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) while talking about the violence that is taking place in the state of Kerala said, “CM called meeting twice, RSS attended but spree of violence is not stopping, it is upto them.” He further talked about how RSS distanced itself from Nathuram Godse and said, “RSS distanced itself from Nathuram Godse also, ghatna hojati hai, hinsa kara dete hain or fir bolte hain hamara lena dena nahi hai” (RSS distanced itself from Nathuram Godse also, after a deed is done they say what do we have to do with it.) This statement of the CPI (M) leader come after a Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) functionary in Ujjain, Kundan Chandrawat shocked everyone with his statement against Kerela chief minister P Vijayan on Thursday. 
Further details awaited.
